etymology.description: 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") tripled = represents various objects -> 品(品) (pǐn, "many people")
etymology.interpretation: The character 品(品) (pǐn, "many people") consists of three 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth"), symbolizing groupings or collections. By tripling 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth"), it conveys a meaning related to gathering, collectively representing multiple items or individuals.

examples.chinese: 市井之品聚集街头(市井之品聚集街頭)。
examples.pinyin: Shì jǐng zhī pǐn jùjí jiētóu.
examples.english: The common people gathered on the streets.

examples.chinese: 音乐会开场时(音樂會開場時)，成百上千品入场(成百上千品入場)。
examples.pinyin: Yīn yuè huì kāichǎng shí, chéng bǎi shàng qiān pǐn rùchǎng.
examples.english: At the start of the concert, hundreds and thousands of people entered.
